attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Why isn't maternity pay determined by how much the mother is earning before she leaves work? 

It is a fact that women are paid less than men today, why? If women are paid less by employers then this surely should cover the mothers time off work. 

A person who has to pay a mortgage of £700 a month and bring up a child has a complete lifestyle change if they go from bringing home £1000 a month to statutory maternity pay (£112 a week)

If I was a mother, I would have to sell my house and live in a council house, but we all know that this would be impossible to achieve. 

The time is now for a maternity pay review. 

Please sign this petition if you agree.
